edu.cuny.ai.learning
Interface Learner

All Superinterfaces:
Resetable
All Known Subinterfaces:
ContinuousLearner, DiscreteLearner, ExposedStimuliResponseLearner, MDPLearner, MimicryLearner, StimuliResponseLearner
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractLearner, AveragingLearner, DumbLearner, DumbRandomLearner, MetaLearner, NArmedBanditLearner, NPTRothErevLearner, QLearner, ReverseDiscountSlidingLearner, RothErevLearner, SlidingWindowLearner, SortedSlidingWindowLearner, StatelessQLearner, WidrowHoffLearner, WidrowHoffLearnerWithMomentum
public interface Learner
extends Resetable

Classes implementing this interface indicate that they implement a learning algorithm.

Version:
$Revision: 1.8 $
Author:
Steve Phelps

Method Summary
 void dumpState(DataWriter out)
          Write out our status data to the specified data writer.
 double getLearningDelta()
          Return a value indicative of the amount of learning that occured during the last iteration.

          initializes after parameters are set up.

Methods inherited from interface edu.cuny.util.Resetable
reset
 

Method Detail

initialize

void initialize()
initializes after parameters are set up.

getLearningDelta

double getLearningDelta()
Return a value indicative of the amount of learning that occured during the last iteration. Values close to 0.0 indicate that the learner has converged to an equilibrium status.

Returns:
A double representing the amount of learning that occured.

dumpState

void dumpState(DataWriter out)
Write out our status data to the specified data writer.

monitor

void monitor()
A hook to provide monitoring functionality. Implementations of learning algorithms should either log, or provide a visualisation of, their status in response to this method.
